ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I was introduced to the Spanish language.
I gained a great introduction to the Spanish language and feel confident going into higher levels of the language.
Introductory vocabulary, grammar of the Spanish language. How to read and write at a basic level.
We learned the basics of the Spanish language. I found learning about the culture of different Spanish speaking countries most interesting.
I learned grammar language and various aspects of spanish-speaking countries

I learned Spanish grammar, several verb tenses, including the preterite, and an abundance of spanish vocabulary, as well as read for comprehension and learned more about the culture of Puerto Rico. I also learned about the location of the Spanish speaking countries of the world.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: My professor was excellent.  She made the class as enjoyable and effective as possible, given the virtual nature of it.
Engaging, but light, very open and kind professor who tries to explain the root meaning of words to help in the learning process

This course was small which was helpful, and everyone was included in each class. It was good that everyone was called on so we could practice speaking and we had lots of projects collaborating, which I liked.
The strengths are that it is a lot of consistent work so you get better at Spanish. The weaknesses are that it was hard to be engaged over zoom.
I do not think that there needs to be as much homework in this course as there was. Otherwise the course was fine.
The strength is definitely found in the professor. She was passionate, warm, and stern but kind. She kept all of us responsible but also made sure we were taken care of.

The three classes a week gives ample time to practice speaking spanish as well as hear it, but the daily homework requirements can be a little too taxing. It may be better to lighten the load on days when class meets, or on weekends.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I do not think there is much room for improvement.
everything was great!
It was a bit tricky to coordinate with people on projects, but for the most part zoom classes ran smoothly and it felt as though we were together most of the time.
I appreciated the asynchronous days.
I think this course was as good as it could be given the circumstance.
Making the class meet on 3 out of 5 of the days instead of all five days worked well. This allowed students to work on the off days and truly understand the material.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes. If you wish to learn Spanish, this is the place.
Yes!!
Yes, this course was a great overview of the basics in Spanish.
Yes, it's a great course to learn Spanish for a beginner.
Yes. This is a great course for any student that wants to begin the process of learning the Spanish language.
Yes. Maripaz will make sure you really understand.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Apps on my phone.
Breakout rooms, videos, music, recorded interviews
Asynchronous workload.
No other modes
Online textbook and videos
